Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. Forty-Six -- $75 Service Charge - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. Forty-Six Proposition
(Service Charge)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. Forty-Six of the Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its Governing Authority, be authorized to assess and to adopt a resolution providing for the assessment of an annual service charge of $75.00, plus a collection charge of $3.75 to be paid to the Tax Collector, per parcel of immovable property located wholly or partly within the boundaries of said Road Lighting District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2016, and ending with the year 2025, for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment, this being a new Service Charge that is reasonably expected to generate approximately $10,500.00 in its first year?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Sterlington (Police Dept.) -- 3.5 Mills - M&BOA - 15 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Sterlington, State of Louisiana (the "Town") under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, the applicable provisions of Chapter 5, Chapter 6-A and Chapter 6-B of Title 18 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, levy, assess and collect annually a special tax of three and one half (3.5) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation of all the property situated within the limits of the Town (an estimated $37,075 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of fifteen years commencing in the year 2016, and ending in the year 2030, to be dedicated and used for improvements, operation and maintenance of police department buildings and the acquisition, maintenance and operation of patrol cars and equipment?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Sterlington (Sports Complex) -- .5% S&U - M&BOA - Perp.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Sterlington, Parish of Ouachita, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect, a tax of one-half of one percent (0.5%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Town, all as defined by law, commencing January 1, 2016 and continuing in perpetuity, the levy of the Tax for the first year is expected to collect approximately $140,000, with the proceeds of the Tax to be dedicated and used to improve, maintain, and/or repair public streets, including related drainage and utilities and to acquire, maintain, operate and equip a new youth sports park and tournament complex, all within the corporate limits of the Town, as determined by the Governing Authority of the Town and for further authority to fund a portion of the avails of the Tax into Bonds in the manner provided by law?
